meanings.definition: To publicly praise or acknowledge someone or something again.
meanings.sent1: After the performance, the audience started reacclaiming the talented singer.
meanings.sent2: The author's latest book is reacclaiming the attention of readers worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The teacher couldn't resist reacclaiming the student's exceptional artwork.
meanings.sent4: The old classic movie is reacclaiming its well-deserved spot in the hearts of viewers.
meanings.sent5: The town was reacclaiming the local hero for his selfless actions.

meanings.definition: To regain recognition or praise for something previously acknowledged.
meanings.sent1: The athlete is reacclaiming his former glory with his recent winning streak.
meanings.sent2: The company is reacclaiming its position as a leader in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be reacclaiming its territory after the dog left.
meanings.sent4: The artist is reacclaiming her unique style in the art world.
meanings.sent5: The team is reacclaiming their championship title with hard work and dedication.
